messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] circumcision and Jewish babies
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/1/2002 1:55:12 PM Central Standard Time, ... Well, it s not wonderful that they are getting cut, but wonderful that the spiritual aspect
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/1/2002 1:55:12 PM Central Standard Time,
Dnowens@... writes:

> Really? Cutting and making it bleed for symbolism is better than cutting all
>
> the way?
>
>

Well, it's not wonderful that they are getting cut, but wonderful that the
spiritual aspect of the whole thing still exists, and the baby gets to keep
his foreskin.

Tuck


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

the rule.

messages.subject: circumcision and Jewish babies
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/1/02 11:06:07 AM, tuckervill@aol.com writes:  First we talked about all the issues, including the one about me and my kids ...
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/1/02 11:06:07 AM, tuckervill@... writes:

<< > First we talked about all the issues, including the one about me and my
kids
>
> being Jewish.

Obviously, that is an angle I failed to consider in my original post. >>

No-circ has a solution to that too, and it's an interesting read. The main
no-circ site says my browser can't read it. Okay fine. But you can go to
google and find some info. They have a kind of cut to make that doesn't take
off the end of the foreskin. It's a little cut, it bleeds, it's symbolism is
intact (and so is the penis).

Sandra
